RAIN and IRHA are non governmental organizations based in the Netherlands and in Switzerland. They are both active in promoting and implementing RWH in local, regional and international levels. Currently they work in supporting poor and marginalized communities in meeting their water needs with particular focus to woman and children. Geographically, they are active in the most poor locations of Africa and Asia with plans to extend to Latin America region. They recognize the benefit of collaboration and joint strategies and expertise in order to enlarge the scope of their activities. they have mutual aim to empower local communities to become self supporting and develop their economies and food production through RWH.

RAIN and IRHA will collaborate to enlarge their scope on promoting and implementing RWH. They will join strategies and share knowledge and expertise in the areas of RWH. They will collaborate in fund raising, capacity building activities. They will formulate strategic actions together to complement each-other on the field and to come out as pressure group among RWH networks and mobilize resources at country, regional and international scale.

RAIN foundation and the International Rainwater Harvesting Network (IRHA) have made partnership to jointly promote rain Water Harvesting (RWH) and empower communities. They collaborate their knowledge and expertise of their staff and their networks to fund raise in different levels, build the capacity of local communities and NGOs, implement awareness raising projects in different regions of the world.

The objectives of this project are to -carry out effective fund raising at different levels -build the capacity of regional and local RWH actors -share knowledge and expertise among their staff and their networks -bring increased awareness on RWH at local and regional and international level
